FBRT - The Function Block RunTime platform

This documentation package contains documentation of the base classes of the classes in the Function Block Runtime (FBRT) platform of the Function Block Development Kit (FBDK). Except for datatypes, these classes are typically invisible to the user of the FBDK.

See:
          Description

Packages
fb.datatype This package contains the runtime implementations of the IEC 61131-3 data types and extensions supported by the FBDK .
fb.rt This package, along with the fb.datatype package, forms the kernel of the function block runtime (FBRT).
fb.rt.hmi This package, along with the fb.datatype and fb.rt packages, forms the kernel of function block runtime (FBRT) versions supporting Human/Machine Interface (HMI) functions.
fb.rt.hmi.matrix This package contains graphical user interface elements for input and output of variables of the MATRIX data type.
fb.rt.math This package provides abstract superclasses and concrete implementations for IEC 61499 function blocks for mathematical operations on IEC 61131-3 data types.
fb.rt.math.matrix This package contains function block types that perform operations on data of type MATRIX.
fb.rt.select This package contains IEC 61499 function block types for Boolean selection and 1-of-n multiplexing functions.

 

This documentation package contains documentation of the base classes of the classes in the Function Block Runtime (FBRT) platform of the Function Block Development Kit (FBDK). Except for datatypes, these classes are typically invisible to the user of the FBDK.

Documentation of some user-visible function block types is provided here in those cases where Java-level documentation is necessary for understanding of their functionality. Otherwise, viewing the XML source of these types with the FBEditor provided with the FBDK should be sufficient.

Detailed documentation is provided for the MATRIX data type and function blocks for input, output and mathematical operations on instances of this type. In addition, a TEST_MATRIX system configuration is provided for the testing of I/O and math operations on instances of this data type.

This documentation is currently incomplete and may be incorrect. Please report any inaccuracies to the FBDK Discussion Group.
